intro: Ardisia opegrapha subsp. paquitensis, commonly known as the Philippine ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various birds and mammals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in lowland and montane forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
